intro: Achyronia setacea, commonly known as the hairy bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hair-like structures that cover its stems and leaves, giving it a fuzzy appearance. This plant is typically found in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and ditches. Achyronia setacea is a carnivorous plant, capable of trapping and digesting small aquatic invertebrates. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptations and ecological interactions.
